result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Romanelli, Vincent Michael

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vincent Michael Romanelli in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dismiss read in Count 1.  Review of victim statements in 15CM635 sentencing.  Court dismisses/read in Count 1.

No contact w/I.A.P., J.N.R. or S.J. or their residences/premises and not to possess any firearms/weapons/ammunition.  May return to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  All familty court orders to be followed according to the children.  Parties may have text/email contact ONLY as to the child placement w/parties.

Pre-trial conference at 01-08-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 01-19-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Vincent Michael Romanelli in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE says he does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  Bond continued.  State requests no contacts/conditions.  DE responds.  Special amended bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/I.A.P., J.N.R. or S.J. or their residences/premises and not to possess any firearms/weapons/ammunition.  May return to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  All family court orders to be followed according to the children.  Parties may have text/email contact ONLY as to the child placement w/parties.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
